intro: Psychotria simmondsiana var. glabrescens, commonly known as the glossy psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers with a distinctive red calyx. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
